result.execSummary:
The defendant John C Dotson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: This sentence is to commence consecutive to any previously imposed sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay restitution of $1457.02, payable to State of Wisconsin - Bureau of State Risk Management

Per Standing Order, defendant to pay the 10% and 5% restitution surcharge.

--To pay statutory court costs on each count
--To pay DNA Surcharge  on each count

--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence of bars, taverns or liquors stores
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: WSP

  Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

The Court denies the Motion.

Case called at 3:08 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant John C Dotson in court with Attorney Hazel Jean Washington. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Cts. #1 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 &#3
ADA Shock submits State's Exh#1-DVD-received (Video 1-played 3:28 - 3:30 pm - Video 2 played 3:31 - 3:36 pm); ADA Shock submits victim impact statement

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Dotson to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any previously imposed sentence

On Count #4, the Court sentences Mr. Dotson to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years. This sentence is to commence consecutive to Count #1. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence of bars, taverns or liquors stores
--To pay restitution of $1457.02, payable to State of Wisconsin - Bureau of State Risk Management
--To pay statutory court costs on each count
--To pay DNA Surcharge on each count
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

1 year driver license suspension on Count #1
6 months driver license suspension on Count #4

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 4:15 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-10-2015 03:00 pm (mailed to Defendant's last known address - he is no longer in custody)

Case called at 10:10 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for plea/sentencing)
Defendant John C Dotson in court, in-custody, with Attorney Hazel Jean Washington. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Washington submits letter with attachments & plea paperwork; ADA Beck submits restitution request & criminal case settlement
Atty Washington informs the Court that there is an error on the criminal case settlement and ADA Shock is unavailable to correct the change
ADA Beck informs the Court that ADA Shock is on vacation and unreachable. Unsure if there is an error on the document or if he had changed his mind on what the offer is. Uncomfortable moving forward today.
Atty Washington informs the Court that if matter is adjourned there will not be a negative effect on Mr. Washington's liberty interests.
ADA Beck confirms that there is no objection from victim to adjournment
Court adjourns plea/sentencing; Atty Washington confirms that Mr. Dotson will remain at MSDC
Court informs Mr. Dotson that if he is moved, he is to inform counsel ASAP so a new writ may be prepared
Recess: 10:16 am
